qas.question: What lifestyle element changed significantly from the paleolithic to the neolithic era?
What era consisted of people living temporary homes?
What type of homes were built in the Neolithic era?
What societal trend was the cause of permanent homes?
Where were entrances located in early homes?

answers.text: Doorways were made on the roof

qas.question: What era consisted of people living on roofs?
What type of homes were built in the paleolithic era?
What societal trend was the cause of mats?
Where were entrances located in early ladders?

context: The <a0_0><b5_0>shelter<b5_0/><a0_0/> of the early people changed dramatically from the paleolithic to the neolithic era. In the <a1_0>paleolithic<a1_0/>, people did not normally live in permanent constructions. In the neolithic, <a2_0><b6_0>mud brick houses<b6_0/><a2_0/> started appearing that were coated with plaster. <a3_0><b7_0>The <b9_0>growth of agriculture<b9_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/> made permanent houses possible. <a4_0>Doorways were made <b8_0>on the roof<b8_0/><a4_0/>, with ladders positioned both on the inside and outside of the houses. The roof was supported by beams from the inside. The rough ground was covered by platforms, mats, and skins on which residents slept. Stilt-houses settlements were common in the Alpine and Pianura Padana (Terramare) region. Remains have been found at the Ljubljana Marshes in Slovenia and at the Mondsee and Attersee lakes in Upper Austria, for example.
